item.title: Katie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Life at a vile boarding school is in this way a good preparation for the Christian life, that it teaches one to live by hope. Even, in a sense, by faith; for at the beginning of each term, home and the holidays are so far off that it is as hard to realize them as it is to realize heaven." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Brenner
item.description: "We cannot attain the presence of God. We're already totally in the presence of God. What's missing is awareness." -- David Brenner

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "It was inevitable: Yankel fell in love with his never-wife. He would wake from sleep to miss the weight that never depressed the bed next to him, remember in earnest the weight of gestures she never made, long for the un-weight of her un-arm slung over his too-real chest, making his widower's rememberences that much more convincing and his pain that much more real." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "This is love, she thought, isn't it? When you notice someone's absence and hate that absence more than anything? More, even, than you love his presence?" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I felt it very moving to feel his touch, and to remember that hands can also show love." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Katie add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "I don't know what to say to her. All I know is, I ain't saying it. And I know she ain't saying what she want a say either and it's a strange thing happening here cause nobody saying nothing and we still managing to have us a conversation." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Katie add a quote by Rosamund Lupton
item.description: "I know that grief is love turned into an eternal missing." -- Rosamund Lupton

item.title: Katie add a quote by Rosamund Lupton
item.description: "...death does leave a daunting array of practical tasks: all those possessions that you were forced to leave behind had to be sorted and packed and redistributed in the living world." -- Rosamund Lupton

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dom M. Basil Pennington
item.description: "Knowing myself as the sinner enables me to know something more: a God of mercy--something greater, for love responds to what is good and lovable; mercy responds to what is not good and makes it good and lovable." -- Dom M. Basil Pennington

item.title: Katie add a quote by David Brenner
item.description: "The truth is that God is to be found in all things--even and most especially in the painful, tragic and unpleasant things." -- David Brenner

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dai Sijie
item.description: "It would evidently take more than a political regime, more than dire poverty to stop a woman from wanting to be well-dressed: it was a desire as old as the world, as old as the desire for children." -- Dai Sijie

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margot Livesey
item.description: "Running, I soon realized, was the best way to stay ahead of fear." -- Margot Livesey

item.title: Katie add a quote by Tatiana de Rosnay
item.description: "Emile was not like you, not attached to houses. For you, houses are like people, are they not, they have a soul, a heart, they live and breathe. Houses remember." -- Tatiana de Rosnay

item.title: Katie add a quote by Tatiana de Rosnay
item.description: "You were a quiet man, yet you took up a vast amount of silent space and that was what I missed." -- Tatiana de Rosnay

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margot Livesey
item.description: "Since the accident, Jonathan had noticed, she held on to things, a doorframe, a chair, as it either she or the world needed steadying." -- Margot Livesey

item.title: Katie add a quote by Margot Livesey
item.description: "All along, he'd been looking in the wrong direction, trying to make time stand still, to re-create the past, but everything in life taught the opposite." -- Margot Livesey

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You're so busy being you that you have no idea how utterly unprecedented you are." -- John Green

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Augustus Waters," I said, looking up at him, thinking that you cannot kiss anyone in the Anne Frank House, and then thinking that Anne Frank, after all, kissed someone in the Anne Frank House, and that she would probably like nothing more than for her home to have become a place where the young and irreparably broken sink into love." -- John Green

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "And in my classes, I will talk most of the time, and you will listen most of the time. Because you may be smart, but I've been smart longer." -- John Green

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I didn't know what to say to her - I was caught in a love triangle with one dead side." -- John Green

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "More than anything, I felt the unfairness of it, the inarguable injustice of loving someone who might have loved you back but can't due to deadness..." -- John Green

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Colin had always preferred baths; one of his general policies in life was never to do anything standing up that could just as easily be done lying down" -- John Green

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "That brief walk--from the screened-in porch outside to the Hearse--was one of those moments he knew he'd remember and look back on, one of those moments that he'd try to capture in the stories he told. Nothing was happening, really, but the moment was thick with mattering." -- John Green

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jenny Han
item.description: "Things weren’t the same with us, not right away, and maybe not ever. We were growing up. We were still figuring out how to be in each other’s lives without being everything to each other." -- Jenny Han

item.title: Katie add a quote by Katie J. Davis
item.description: "Thankfully, God's plans do not seem to be affected much by my own." -- Katie J. Davis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Katie J. Davis
item.description: "We are not called to be safe, we are simply promised that when we are in danger, God is right there with us. And there is no better place to be than in His hands." -- Katie J. Davis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Katie J. Davis
item.description: "I am blown away that my God, who could do this all by Himself, would choose to let me be a little part of it." -- Katie J. Davis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Katie J. Davis
item.description: "I put value in things. These children, having no things, put value in God. I put my trust in relationships; these children, having already seen relationships fail, put their trust in the Lord." -- Katie J. Davis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Katie J. Davis
item.description: "Adoption is a beautiful picture of redemption. It is the Gospel in my living room." -- Katie J. Davis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Katie J. Davis
item.description: "Adoption is a redemptive response to tragedy that happens in this broken world." -- Katie J. Davis
